trans-unit.source: Application Insights for ASP.NET
trans-unit.target: Application Insights for ASP.NET

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio Application Insights</linkText><title></title> monitors your live application to help you <linkText>detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions[detect]</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>discover how your app is used[knowusers]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio Application Insights</linkText><title></title> monitors your live application to help you <linkText>detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions[detect]</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>discover how your app is used[knowusers]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It can be used with a wide variety of application types.
trans-unit.target: It can be used with a wide variety of application types.

trans-unit.source: It works for apps that are hosted on your own on-premises IIS servers or on Azure VMs, as well as Azure web apps.
trans-unit.target: It works for apps that are hosted on your own on-premises IIS servers or on Azure VMs, as well as Azure web apps.

trans-unit.source: (<linkText>Device apps and Java servers are also covered[start]</linkText><title></title>.)
trans-unit.target: (<linkText>Device apps and Java servers are also covered[start]</linkText><title></title>.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Example performance monitoring charts</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Example performance monitoring charts</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You need:
trans-unit.target: You need:

trans-unit.source: A subscription to <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A subscription to <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your <linkText>Microsoft account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your <linkText>Microsoft account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 update 3 or later.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 update 3 or later.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, make sure Application Insights is selected.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, make sure Application Insights is selected.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an ASP.NET project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an ASP.NET project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Right click the project in Solution Explorer, and choose Add Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Right click the project in Solution Explorer, and choose Add Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Add Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Add Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If this is your first time, you'll be asked login or sign up to Microsoft Azure Preview.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first time, you'll be asked login or sign up to Microsoft Azure Preview.

trans-unit.source: (It's separate from your Visual Studio Online account.)
trans-unit.target: (It's separate from your Visual Studio Online account.)

trans-unit.source: If this app is part of a bigger application, you might want to use Configure settings to put it in the same resource group as the other components.
trans-unit.target: If this app is part of a bigger application, you might want to use Configure settings to put it in the same resource group as the other components.

trans-unit.source: The command did these steps (which you could instead do manually if you prefer):
trans-unit.target: The command did these steps (which you could instead do manually if you prefer):

trans-unit.source: Creates an Application Insights resource in <linkText>the Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Creates an Application Insights resource in <linkText>the Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This is where you'll see your data.
trans-unit.target: This is where you'll see your data.

trans-unit.source: It retrieves the instrumentation key, which identifies the resource.
trans-unit.target: It retrieves the instrumentation key, which identifies the resource.

trans-unit.source: Adds the Application Insights Web SDK NuGet package to your project.
trans-unit.target: Adds the Application Insights Web SDK NuGet package to your project.

trans-unit.source: To see it in Visual Studio, right-click your project and choose Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: To see it in Visual Studio, right-click your project and choose Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: Places the instrumentation key in ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: Places the instrumentation key in ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: Run your application with F5 and try it out: open different pages to generate some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Run your application with F5 and try it out: open different pages to generate some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.

trans-unit.source: Open your Application Insights resource in the <linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Open your Application Insights resource in the <linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Right-click your project and open the Azure portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Right-click your project and open the Azure portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Look for data in the Overview charts.
trans-unit.target: Look for data in the Overview charts.

trans-unit.source: At first, you'll just see one or two points.
trans-unit.target: At first, you'll just see one or two points.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click through to more data</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click through to more data</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about metrics.[perf]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about metrics.[perf]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Now deploy your application and watch the data accumulate.
trans-unit.target: Now deploy your application and watch the data accumulate.

trans-unit.source: When you run in debug mode, telemetry is expedited through the pipeline, so that you should see data appearing within seconds.
trans-unit.target: When you run in debug mode, telemetry is expedited through the pipeline, so that you should see data appearing within seconds.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy your app, data accumulates more slowly.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy your app, data accumulates more slowly.

trans-unit.source: Open the <linkText>Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> tile, to see individual events.
trans-unit.target: Open the <linkText>Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> tile, to see individual events.

trans-unit.source: Use the application, opening different pages so that it generates some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Use the application, opening different pages so that it generates some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Wait a few seconds and click Refresh.
trans-unit.target: Wait a few seconds and click Refresh.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Please see <linkText>this Troubleshooting item</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Please see <linkText>this Troubleshooting item</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Browser or client-side monitoring gives you data on users, sessions, page views, and any exceptions or crashes that occur in the browser.
trans-unit.target: Browser or client-side monitoring gives you data on users, sessions, page views, and any exceptions or crashes that occur in the browser.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose New, Developer Services, Application Insights.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose New, Developer Services, Application Insights.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You'll also be able to write your own code to track how your users work with your app, right down to the detailed level of clicks and keystrokes.
trans-unit.target: You'll also be able to write your own code to track how your users work with your app, right down to the detailed level of clicks and keystrokes.

trans-unit.source: If your app displays web pages, add a JavaScript snippet to every page.
trans-unit.target: If your app displays web pages, add a JavaScript snippet to every page.

trans-unit.source: Get the code from your Application Insights resource:
trans-unit.target: Get the code from your Application Insights resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In your web app, open Quick Start and click 'Get code to monitor my web pages'</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In your web app, open Quick Start and click 'Get code to monitor my web pages'</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Notice that the code contains the instrumentation key that identifies your application resource.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the code contains the instrumentation key that identifies your application resource.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about web page tracking.</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about web page tracking.</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: If your application is serving clients such as phones or other devices, add the <linkText>appropriate SDK</linkText><title></title> to your device app.
trans-unit.target: If your application is serving clients such as phones or other devices, add the <linkText>appropriate SDK</linkText><title></title> to your device app.

trans-unit.source: If you configure the client SDK with the same instrumentation key as the server SDK, the two streams will be integrated so that you can see them together.
trans-unit.target: If you configure the client SDK with the same instrumentation key as the server SDK, the two streams will be integrated so that you can see them together.

trans-unit.source: When you've delivered a new user story, you'd like to know how much your customers are using it, and whether they are achieving their goals or having difficulties.
trans-unit.target: When you've delivered a new user story, you'd like to know how much your customers are using it, and whether they are achieving their goals or having difficulties.

trans-unit.source: Get a detailed picture of user activity by inserting TrackEvent() and other calls in your code, both at the client and server.
trans-unit.target: Get a detailed picture of user activity by inserting TrackEvent() and other calls in your code, both at the client and server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use the API to track usage[api]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use the API to track usage[api]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Capture log traces[netlogs]</linkText><title></title> from your favorite logging framework to help diagnose any problems.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Capture log traces[netlogs]</linkText><title></title> from your favorite logging framework to help diagnose any problems.

trans-unit.source: Your log entries will appear in <linkText>diagnostic search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> along with the Application Insights telemetry events.
trans-unit.target: Your log entries will appear in <linkText>diagnostic search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> along with the Application Insights telemetry events.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet published your app (since you added Application Insights), do that now.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet published your app (since you added Application Insights), do that now.

trans-unit.source: Watch the data grow in the charts as people use your app.
trans-unit.target: Watch the data grow in the charts as people use your app.

trans-unit.source: For a major application, it's advisable to send telemetry data from debugging, testing and production into <linkText>separate resources</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a major application, it's advisable to send telemetry data from debugging, testing and production into <linkText>separate resources</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dependency metrics</linkText><title></title> can be invaluable to help you diagnose performance issues.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dependency metrics</linkText><title></title> can be invaluable to help you diagnose performance issues.

trans-unit.source: They measure calls from your app to databases, REST APIs, and other external components.
trans-unit.target: They measure calls from your app to databases, REST APIs, and other external components.

trans-unit.source: Login to your server with admin rights, and install <linkText>Application Insights Status Monitor</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Login to your server with admin rights, and install <linkText>Application Insights Status Monitor</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: (You can also use Status Monitor to <linkText>instrument an app that's already running</linkText><title></title>, even if it hasn't been built with the SDK.)
trans-unit.target: (You can also use Status Monitor to <linkText>instrument an app that's already running</linkText><title></title>, even if it hasn't been built with the SDK.)

trans-unit.source: In the control panel of your Azure Web App, add the Application Insights extension.
trans-unit.target: In the control panel of your Azure Web App, add the Application Insights extension.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In your web app, Settings, Extensions, Add, Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In your web app, Settings, Extensions, Add, Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: (The extension only assists an app that has been built with the SDK.
trans-unit.target: (The extension only assists an app that has been built with the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Unlike Status Monitor, it can't instrument an existing app.)
trans-unit.target: Unlike Status Monitor, it can't instrument an existing app.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set up web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title> to test from the outside that your application is live and responsive.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set up web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title> to test from the outside that your application is live and responsive.

trans-unit.source: To upgrade to a <linkText>new release of the SDK</linkText><title></title>, open NuGet package manager again and filter on installed packages.
trans-unit.target: To upgrade to a <linkText>new release of the SDK</linkText><title></title>, open NuGet package manager again and filter on installed packages.

trans-unit.source: Select Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web and choose Upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Select Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web and choose Upgrade.

trans-unit.source: If you made any customizations to ApplicationInsights.config, save a copy of it before you upgrade, and afterwards merge your changes into the new version.
trans-unit.target: If you made any customizations to ApplicationInsights.config, save a copy of it before you upgrade, and afterwards merge your changes into the new version.
